nodes.bodyText:
Methods with multiple numeric parameters can get confusing (we have String, long, int here). I think I'd prefer to set maxMessages in an overloaded PubSubReactiveFactory constructor.
Upsides:

we get to keep a single poll() method.
maxMessages can be autoconfigured to current max int value by default and overridden with a property, keeping it backwards compatible and consistent with how we configure other functionality.
maxMessages won't need to be propagated from poll() to pollingPull() to pullAll().

Downside:

different instances of the factory have to be created if different maxMessages settings are required in a single application. This is mitigated by how lightweight PubSubReactiveFactory is; it's just a wrapper around PubSubTemplate and a reactor scheduler.

@meltsufin What do you think?

Overloaded constructor or overloaded poll methods would work. Since it affects multiple methods, constructor is probably preferred.
Either way, the way it is now, is not good because it would causes a breaking change.
